Summary WHO AM I: A driven legal eagle passionate to lead and manage talented cross-functional teams to create win-win projects/deals and to foster a supportive work-environment for others. 
 
BIOGRAPHY: A international multi-lingual corpprate in-house attorney and business partner with over 15+ years experience in Intellectual Property licensing, Commercial negotiations, and Compliance (Anti-Trust, Security and Privacy) policy creation/training within the industries of Technology (Semiconductors) and Arts/Entertainment. My work addresses legal boundaries to a company's strategic goals. Present transactions I support include a R&D amd manufacturing joint venture, business development proposals, pricing strategies, and complex commercial negotiations. Experience includes positions as a adjunct aw lecturer in Frankfurt Germany, in-house counsel for an international entertainment company, law firm associate, I-Banking intern, and even a senior financial analyst. Summary ► US (NY) and EU (French and UK) qualified attorney with recognized expertise in US and International laws, a MBA degree, and over 15 years of law firm and in-house experience in both large and medium size US publicly-listed corporations in the technology sector  
► Expertise in both civil law and common law legal systems  
► Broad range of US and international legal and compliance expertise  
► Strong business acumen; entrepreneurial, leadership and technology expertise 
 
Main areas of practice include technology law, software law, cyberlaw, internet law, computer, e-commerce, IP and IT law, as well as social media law, privacy and data security law, under French, UK and US law. Experience Owner Law Office of S. Grynwajc, PLLC January 2011  – Present (4 years 8 months) Greater New York City Area Admitted as a lawyer in France, the UK and the US (NY), I advise entrepreneurs, start ups and small to mid-size companies in their operations in Europe and in the US.  
 
I serve as acting General Counsel to a number of small and medium size companies that require dedicated, in-house legal management and resources, but are not yet large enough to justify hiring a full-time in-house counsel.  
 
I also provide my services in support of established in-house legal departments of all sizes which need temporary additional resources on a part time basis to support their operations. 
 
In either of the above capacities, my former 15 years of experience as in-house counsel in the EU and the US advising corporations in their international operations, together with my ability to draft/negotiate agreements and provide legal expertise under both US and European laws is a strong asset, particularly in the following situations: 
 
1. Company A is US-based and is looking to do business in Europe but does not have a presence there. Company A needs a lawyer who can localize its contract templates to EU laws, but also negotiate these contracts in the local language and under local laws in the foreign country.  
 
2. Company B is EU-based or recently opened an office in the US. Company B wants a lawyer who can localize its EU-modeled contracts for use in the US, but who can also negotiate these contracts with US-based suppliers, customers and partners.  
 
In these situations many companies can't afford to retain the services of a foreign office of a large law firm. This is where I come in. My services offer the following benefits: 
 
COST EFFECTIVENESS: Through outsourcing, companies can significantly reduce their fixed costs, such as employee staff costs 
 
SCALABILITY: Companies can flexibly scale their operations on an as needed basis 
 
EXPERTISE: Many years of experience for an affordable cost Director, Legal and Head of Compliance EMEA Symantec Corporation October 2004  –  December 2010  (6 years 3 months) London, United Kingdom Regional Head of Legal and Compliance Lead Counsel for EMEA 
 
* Lead Legal Support to International Sales and Services operations 
* Drafting/negotiating technology agreements (e.g. end-user licenses, consulting, outsourcing, support); 
* Developed and managed the localization of contracts negotiation playbooks. Assisted in development of multi-jurisdictional online tool for contract negotiation. 
 
* Overall responsibility for international Privacy compliance: 
- strategic development and implementation of global privacy programs; 
- monitoring of continued compliance with US and international laws; 
- drafting global and region/country-specific policies, procedures and guidelines; 
- managing cross-border data flows in compliance with international legal requirements; 
- developing and delivering various cross-regional training and awareness programs; 
- overseeing up-to-date registration and filings with local authorities; 
- conducting PRAs of all BU initiatives involving the process 
 
* Overall responsibility for international FCPA/Anti-Corruption efforts: 
- reviewing/localizing corporate policies against local anti-corruption legislation  
- implementing various regional/localized employee trainings on FCPA, UK Bribery Act and other national legislations and corporate policies; 
- conducting compliance risk assessments of employee, third party and company business activity; 
- supervising revisions, issuance and dissemination of Code of Conduct and corporate policies on a global basis, and associated training; 
- conducting investigations, and drafting reports regarding potential violations of company policies; 
- advising on and assisting with the development, adaptation, localization and maintenance of global compliance online information resources; 
- implementing complaint procedures/whistleblower mechanisms on a global basis. 
 
* Overall responsibility for monitoring other international compliance areas (e.g., insider trading, antitrust, gifts, expenses, anti-harassement). General Counsel, EMEA Altiris, Inc. October 2004  –  June 2007  (2 years 9 months) London, United Kingdom Overseeing all legal activity in EMEA. Secondary legal support to US operations. 
- Set up and managed an internationally-based legal team to support all EMEA business operations 
- Set up and managed the EMEA Legal budget 
- Key member of the company's EMEA management 
 
* Drafted and negotiated numerous software licensing and associated support and services agreements under various laws (e.g. US, UK, French, German). Ensured the up-to-date localization of all agreement templates to various local EU laws 
 
* Responsible for all IP matters in EMEA, e.g. brand protection, trademark registration and enforcement, and general international/in-country litigation. Trained software developers and other R&D staff on various aspects of IP (e.g. patents and other IP rights, Open Source/Linux, Use of 3rd party code) and assisted US patent prosecution team with securing invention disclosures from engineers and developing the company's patent portfolio. Supported the group's EMEA R&D activities. 
 
* Provided lead international support to the channel and marketing organizations, reviewing press releases, documentation and other materials for truth in advertising, ensuring proper TM usage and general compliance with national advertising legislations. Drafted and negotiated agreements with PR agencies across Europe. Supervised the creation of local websites/web portals in Europe. 
 
* Managed the day-to-day corporate administration of the various legal entities in EMEA. Oversaw the corporate integration in EMEA of the company's acquisitions, handled TUPE transfers, drafted intercompany asset purchase agreements,etc. Assisted in the review and drafting of the merger documentation with Symantec, and assisted with post-merger integration issues 
 
* Advised on all labor and employment-related issues in EMEA. Assisted with drafting employment policies and with implementing the company's Code of Conduct in Europe 
 
* Managed all HR and commercial litigation in EMEA Senior Attorney Intel Corporation August 2000  –  October 2004  (4 years 3 months) Swindon, United Kingdom EMEA Lead Business Counsel, Intel Communications Group 
 
* Advised business unit management on legal strategy, and directly resolved legal issues, with a particular focus on commercial and business law, technology and IP licensing and contract negotiations under common law (US/UK) as well as continental Europe's civil laws. Provided regular training to clients on IP and software licensing, SIG participation, GPL/LGPL, CPL and other Open Source licensing issues. Designed and implemented IP protection programs across EMEA, conducted patent harvestings at over 30 engineering sites, trained over 600 engineers and assisted in the submission of over 400 invention disclosure forms in support of EPO/PCT and/or US patent prosecution 
 
* Provided support to clients on major sales negotiations with key US and EMEA-based accounts. Supported the company's EMEA channel organization and managed contract relationships with pan-EMEA and in-country distributors of networking and communications products and technologies in the geography.  
 
* Advised on marketing issues, reviewing marketing and sales material for truth in advertising, ensuring proper TM usage and compliance with EU and national advertising legislations. Advised on issues relating to promotions and contests across Europe. 
 
* Designed and implemented customized legal integration plans for the company's European-based acquisitions, and delivered inductive legal training (e.g. IP, Privacy, Antitrust, Confidentiality) to new employees in English, Spanish and French. Managed entity mergers/liquidations and any associated contract assignments and/or terminations. Oversaw the corporate integration and bookkeeping of the various acquired legal entities. 
 
* Managed litigation and/or ADR in the geography, and reporting out to corporate HQ on the status of various court proceedings. Drafted and negotiated several out-of-court settlements. Legal Counsel EMEA Schlumberger Technologies September 1997  –  May 2000  (2 years 9 months) Paris Area, France * Drafted and negotiated various domestic and international contracts (e.g. sales, maintenance, OEM, reseller, agency, distribution, licensing, consortia, technology and other IP-related agreements) under various EU national laws. Reviewed public and private procurements, as well as bids for state and local government contracts.  
 
* Trained clients on various aspects of contracts and other agreement forms, as well as on branding and the use of the company's trademarks 
 
* Maintained the subsidiary/branch office database in over 20 jurisdictions, and provided legal support on M&A related activity 
 
* Managed litigation and alternative dispute resolution across EMEA Associate Anderson Kill & Olick February 1997  –  August 1997  (7 months) Greater New York City Area Lecturer of English Law University of Paris X School of Law September 1992  –  June 1995  (2 years 10 months) Paris Area, France Lectured over 600 French law students on the English legal system and fundamentals of English law Associate, M&A Practice Group Shearman & Sterling June 1994  –  May 1995  (1 year) Paris Area, France * Negotiated various corporate reorganizations and participated in the preparatory documentation for the privatisation of two French multinationals 
 
* Conducted due diligence reviews and extensive legal research in various areas of corporate and securities laws 
 
* Drafted several offering prospectuses and corporate memoranda 
 
* Performed work involving Public and Rule 144A Offerings and other compliance issues in French and US securities laws Summer Associate Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer October 1993  –  December 1993  (3 months) Paris Area, France Arbitration department Summer Associate Autorité des marchés financiers (French equivalent of the US SEC) June 1993  –  September 1993  (4 months) Paris Area, France * Participated in the negotiation and conclusion of mutual assistance and recognition agreements between the French and several foreign financial markets' regulatory authorities 
 
* Drafted a comparataive analysis of the rules governing futures markets in France and Germany 
 
* Conducted a survey of the world's main emerging financial markets Owner Law Office of S.
